intro: Elaphoglossum ignambiense, commonly known as the Ignambiense holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically bi- or tri-pinnate. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its fertile fronds, which are clustered in sori. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
